headline.main: 'Astronaut' Teng Gets New View of World in Houston; Politicians Appear Nervous

results.snippet: HOUSTON, Feb. 2--Teng Hsiao-ping, who is using his trip to the United States to dramatize China's eagerness for advanced technology, climbed into the cockpit of a space shuttle flight simulator here today to discover what it would be like to land...

byline.original: By JOSEPH LELYVELD Special to The New York Times

results.lead_paragraph: HOUSTON, Feb. 2--Teng Hsiao-ping, who is using his trip to the United States to dramatize China's eagerness for advanced technology, climbed into the cockpit of a space shuttle flight simulator here today to discover what it would be like to land this newest American spacecraft from an altitude of 100,000 feet.

results.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, Feb. 4 Several senators plan to seek a commitment from the Carter Administration to sell advanced jet fighter aircraft that were previously refused to Taiwan as part of the price for Congressional support for the termination of the mutual defense treaty with Taiwan.

results.abstract: Natl Inst of Mental Health study concludes that 1st-born children in small families, particularly sons, tend to be bright, over-achievers, do better in life and have higher IQ scores than siblings; also finds: 'only' child also scores well; as birth order fell, scores also fell, but birth order seems to have an inverse relationship to popularity; R B Zajone and Gregory B Markus (Univ of Mich) and Dr Julius Segal (Natl Inst of Mental health) comment (M)

headline.main: Study Finds First-Born Have Higher I.Q.'s; Study Finds First-Borns Are Smarter

results.snippet: ROCKVILLE, Md.  A NEW report from the National Institute of Mental Health here concludes that first-born children in small families tend  to be bright over-achievers, and that the only child also scores well, although he may be less popular than...
results.lead_paragraph: ROCKVILLE, Md. A NEW report from the National Institute of Mental Health here concludes that first-born children in small families tend to be bright over-achievers, and that the only child also scores well, although he may be less popular than others among his classmates and contemporaries.

headline.main: 2 Groups Divide on Space Shuttle; Shortage of Engines Cited Advisory Panel Optimistic

results.snippet: WASHINGTON, Feb. 22 (UPI)--An outside review committee told Congress today that another long delay was likely for the first flight of the space shuttle, but another advisory panel said the shuttle would probably fly in November as planned.
results.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, Feb. 22 (UPI)--An outside review committee told Congress today that another long delay was likely for the first flight of the space shuttle, but another advisory panel said the shuttle would probably fly in November as planned.

headline.main: 2 Soviet Astronauts Are Sent Aloft; In Orbit 16 Months

results.snippet: MOSCOW, Feb. 25 (UPI) The Soviet Union sent two astronauts into space today aboard Soyuz 32 to check the abandoned Salyut 6 space laboratory for possible use by Russian spacemen, the official Soviet press agency, Tass, reported.

results.abstract: Last total solar eclipse in continental US until yr 2017 darkens skies in US Northwest; thousands watch spectacle; illus (M)

headline.main: Total Eclipse of the Sun Darkens Skies in Northwest; Total Eclipse Casts Two Minutes of Darkness in West

results.snippet: LAVINA, Mont., Feb. 26--The moon's dark shadow swept across the northwestern states today, treating thousands of spellbound viewers to the last total solar eclipse the continental United States will see until the year 2017.

byline.original: By MALCOLM W. BROWNE Special to The New York Times

headline.main: Eclipse Groupies Follow the Sun; Five Hundred Eclipse Groupies Follow the Sun to Totality

results.snippet: BIG SKY. MONT. FIVE hundred fools stood freezing their feet off in the snow in the dark by an obscure highway Monday morning, every one of  them as happy as a swilled hog in the sunshine.
